name: Anasazi Museum
short_description: Interprets a large Ancestral Puebloan village occupied from AD 1160 to 1235.

name: Antelope Island
short_description: Protects Antelope Island, the largest island in the Great Salt Lake and habitat for bison, Pronghorn, and bighorn sheep.

name: Bear Lake
short_description: Comprises three units on Bear Lake.

name: Camp Floyd / Stagecoach Inn and Museum
short_description: Interprets sites from the time of a massive 1858-1861 U.S. Army camp prompted by fear of the Utah War.

name: Coral Pink Sand Dunes
short_description: Preserves the only dune field on the Colorado Plateau, with a unique color caused by iron oxides and minerals in the Navajo sandstone.

name: Dead Horse Point
short_description: Showcases views of the Colorado River and Canyonlands National Park from a finger of land once used as a horse corral.

name: Deer Creek
short_description: Adjoins the extremely popular 2,965-acre  Deer Creek Reservoir.

name: East Canyon
short_description: Features a reservoir in a canyon first traversed by the Donner Party and soon thereafter by Mormon pioneers.

name: Echo
short_description: Echo Reservoir recreation.

name: Edge of the Cedars Museum
short_description: Interprets an Ancestral Puebloan village occupied from AD 825 to 1125.

name: Escalante Petrified Forest
short_description: Features petrified wood and other fossils plus a recreational reservoir.

name: Flight Park State Recreation Area
short_description: Offers one of the world's best training sites for hang gliding and parasailing, plus a modelport for radio control aircraft.

name: Fremont Indian and Museum
short_description: Preserves rock art and artifacts from the largest Fremont culture village yet discovered.

name: Frontier Homestead Museum
short_description: Preserves historic structures and equipment from the 1850s to the 1920s, including Old Iron Town and an extensive collection of horse-drawn vehicles. Formerly called Iron Mission.

name: Goblin Valley
short_description: Showcases an unearthly landscape of hoodoos and other rock formations.

name: Goosenecks
short_description: Overlooks some dramatic meanders of the San Juan River.

name: Great Salt Lake
short_description: Maintains a public boat launch and 320-slip marina on the Great Salt Lake.

name: Green River
short_description: Features a shady campground, nine-hole golf course, and float trip launching on the Green River.

name: Gunlock
short_description: Adjoins a 266-acre  reservoir.

name: Historic Union Pacific Rail Trail
short_description: Comprises a 28-mile  rail trail on a route used by the Union Pacific Railroad from 1880 to 1989.

name: Huntington
short_description: Features a warm-water reservoir.

name: Hyrum
short_description: Surrounds a 450-acre  reservoir.

name: Jordan River Off-Highway Vehicle State Recreation Area
short_description: Offers four tracks for off highway vehicles along the Jordan River.

name: Jordanelle
short_description: Comprises two recreation areas on Jordanelle Reservoir.

name: Kodachrome Basin
short_description: Showcases 67 rock spires and other geologic wonders in a basin so photogenic it was named after Kodachrome film.

name: Millsite
short_description: Features a reservoir and lands for off highway vehicles and mountain biking.

name: Otter Creek
short_description: Features a 3,120-acre  reservoir, begun in 1897 as one of the earliest dam projects in Utah.

name: Palisade
short_description: Features a reservoir and 18-hole golf course on the former site of a private resort founded in the 1860s.

name: Piute
short_description: Protects a quiet fishing reservoir on the Sevier River.

name: Quail Creek
short_description: Adjoins a 600-acre  reservoir surrounded by red rock desert.

name: Red Fleet
short_description: Features a 750-acre  reservoir and a fossil trackway of dinosaur footprints.

name: Rockport
short_description: Features a 1,080-acre  reservoir.

name: Sand Hollow
short_description: Features a 1,322-acre  reservoir and an extensive off highway vehicle recreation area.

name: Scofield
short_description: Features a 2,800-acre  reservoir.

name: Snow Canyon
short_description: Showcases a canyon carved out of colorful Navajo sandstone and landforms created by the Santa Clara Volcano.

name: Starvation
short_description: Features a 3,495-acre  reservoir where early settlers once struggled against starvation.

name: Steinaker
short_description: Features an 820-acre  reservoir.

name: This Is the Place Heritage Park
short_description: Interprets Utah's settlement era with a living history village and This Is the Place Monument.

name: Territorial Statehouse Museum
short_description: Interprets the capitol of Utah Territory, the state's oldest government building, constructed between 1852 and 1855.

name: Utah Field House of Natural History Museum
short_description: Houses a state-owned museum of natural history.

name: Utah Lake
short_description: Adjoins Utah Lake, the state's largest body of fresh water.

name: Wasatch Mountain
short_description: Features extensive recreational developments, including facilities built for the 2002 Winter Olympics.

name: Willard Bay
short_description: Provides water recreation opportunities on a 9,900-acre  freshwater reservoir on the floodplain of the Great Salt Lake.

name: Yuba
short_description: Features a reservoir on the Sevier River.
